title: FPS...
body:
K. I know I have an overqualified system for this game. This isn't the only game I play. Anyway, here are the specs: CPU: Intel i7 5820k (not oc'd)
CPU Cooler: Noctua NH-D15 (dual fan tower)
GPU: MSI GAMING X GTX 1080
MOBO: ASRock Fatal1ty X99 Professional Gaming i7
MEMORY: Corsair Vengeance LPX 32GB
SSD: Samsung EVO 120GB
HDD: Western Digital 1TB Fans: 3 intake and 1 exhaust

IMO, this is a great setup for the serious gamer/streamer/whatever...
I play all AAA games at max with great results... DOOM, BF4, BF1(Beta), Overwatch etc. all nearing 200-300 fps constant (depending on the game cap).
So tell me why I'm dipping below 100 fps when playing a game like league of legends... I know the game is old and have read that whatever API they use is trash, but really? I should be slaying this game, it's unbearable. I'm farming in lane and am floating around the 100 fps mark (this doesn't look to great on a 144hz monitor).
End of rant. I just want to have a good experience when playing this game.

replies.body:
You didn't list your OS, but I assume you're running Windows 10. If this is true, this could be caused by the anniversary update that enabled *Game DVR* in the Windows Game Bar. I recommend [disabling this feature](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) as a quick check to see if that was the issue.

Let me know if this helped.
Yes, I am running windows 10. I don't believe this DVR feature automatically enabled itself, I will check on it and update
I'm now having constant feezes too with Windows 10 update, and my DVR didn't magically turn on. What's going on?

Okay, so the DVR did enable itself somehow (even though I had never launched the Xbox app before). Anyway, I turned it off and noticed no change. FPS is all over the place ranging from 80-400 fps, with an average of 150. This is very unstable when playing this game. I don't plan on turning vertical sync off, as I don't want to play with delay. This didn't always happen. Somewhere around early path 5.9-6.0 is where this started to begin. Before that I had no issues.

In that case, there are likely other settings local to your PC causing the issue. Check out our [FPS Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) for some common solutions for this.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

I'm having the same issues (Asus laptop, Windows 10). I did every step in the FPS Guide and took my laptop to 2 different computer repair places. They performed PC diagnostics and both places said my hardware and software checked out. Even when I set my in-game video settings to the lowest settings, I still get drops as low as 3 fps. It's actually gotten more frequent in the past week. So...what do I do now?
